reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel Privilege is well situated for visiting Florence. We stayed with a group of ten people for four nights, and found the accommodations comfortable, the breakfast excellent, and the hospitality of Barbara and Emmanuelle to be warm, gracious and helpful.
reviews.title: Hotel Privilege, a splendid place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel Privilege overlooks the Arno about three long (long) blocks up river from Ponte Vecchio. It is also handy to the neighborhood around
reviews.title: Truly a Privilege

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Piazza San Ambrigio, which has my favorite outdoor market and shops.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with Best Coffee in Europe!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms included air conditioning, which was welcome even in late September. The beds were comfortable, and the rooms good sized.
reviews.title: Location is just perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't speak highly enough of the service Emannuelle and Barbara provide. They both speak English, Emannuelle more that Barbara. They were happy to help us with directions, reservations, cabs, and information.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is on the banks of the River Arno about a 5 minute walk from the Piazza S Croze, 5-10 minutes to the Uffizi Gallery and about 15 - 20 minute walk to the Duomo.
reviews.title: Old Charming Hotel, Great Location

likes.disliked: — Not enough plug sockets - that's it really!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on a biking holiday and they had a separate garage area where we could store our bikes for our two night stay in Florence. The hotel is old and at some point the rooms may need updating, but despite that it had a lovely old charm feel to it and was probably quite grand at some point in its past. The hotel owners / staff were very friendly and attentive and it had quite a family feel for a largish hotel.
reviews.title: Rooms a bit dated but overall fine

likes.liked: — Friendly helpful staff, breakfast, room with a bath
likes.disliked: — Traffic noise at front of hotel

reviews.title: Felt Like Family at Hotel Privilege
reviews.text: Our room had a bath, minibar and TV and overlooked the River Arno onto the greenery beyond on the south bank. It was also a fair size. The only complaint I would have is that there was a lack of plug sockets, and the one that was accessible didn’t work meaning that you had to use the plug in the bathroom to charge things up, which didn’t feel that safe to me.

reviews.title: most welcoming owners
reviews.text: There was a good selection at breakfast including breads, fruit, cheese, ham, cereals and yoghurts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of those hotels that was probably quite grand in its day. That’s not to say that its run down or seeing hard times now, but looking at the décor and furnishings, I think its fair to say that it has become a little dated over the years.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Privilege for 2 nights in August 2007. Well located for the traditional areas of Florence, the major sights were within comfortable walking distance.
reviews.title: Pleasant Privilege

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The proprietor and his wife were very helpful, he especially spoke good English.
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is very traditional but clean and well furnished - the only complaint with our room would be that the shower area needed refurbishing.
reviews.title: A rare and true find!

likes.disliked: — Nothing other than perhaps more TV channels in English but then again, who goes to Florence to watch TV.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast selection was excellent, plenty of choice and continuously replenished - however the breakfast room was small so you may have to wait for a table.
reviews.title: A Little Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rack rates are quite high but if you can get an internet booking deal the hotel offers very good value for money.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel has the most delightful host and hostess. They are a married couple who seem to always be available (don't they ever go home?). We felt most welcomed every time we came through the door way. The breakfasts were super! Boiled eggs, tortes, cheese, lox, fruit, juices, yogurt, espresso or cappuchino, milk, sliced meats--with encouragement from the hostess (You eat nothing!). A patio under the trees outside overlooks the streets.
reviews.title: Right on the Arno River
Wonderful small hotel on the Arno River.
reviews.text: We could not get lost because all we had to do was to find the Arno river, look for a tall landmark, and there we were, home for the evening!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Privilege for 3 nights in the middle of July, based on the reviews we had read on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed and I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Florence.
reviews.title: Comfortable & Quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was the largest we had in Italy, and we chose the room with two twin beds. They were long and extremely comfortable... after staying at 3 other hotels with harder mattresses, the nice mattresses were a welcome relief. The room was clean and very quiet (I'm very picky about this so I had requested, and we were given, a room that faced the courtyard). The air conditioning was plentiful (very important in the summer) versus other hotels that controlled how low you could set the temperature or only allowed A/C after a certain hour. The bathroom was also larger than all of the others we experienced, including the shower stall. The TV was larger, too -- I would guess about 27" to 32".
reviews.title: Hotel hosts make the stay excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly. They helped me change a restaurant reservation without my even asking them to make the call, gave us directions, and answered all our questions. They were knowledgable and helpful, and their English was good.
reviews.title: Not disappointed

likes.liked: — Excellent value and close to most things.
likes.disliked: — nothing really,room a little tired but roomy.

reviews.title: The Staff Makes it Wonderful
reviews.text: The breakfast was the most impressive we'd seen during our trip, including (but not limited to) plenty of fresh fruit, rolls, croissants, dry cereal, meat, and my favorite, smoked salmon. The orange juice and coffee were good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location on the Arno, a 5 minute walk to Santa Croce and 10 minutes to the Ponte Vecchio. One of our favorite restaurants was La Giostra (recommended also by the staff). I would recommend eating indoors -- the ambience is quite nice (we ate in the room on the left, if you are facing the entrances). If you are weird about salt, stay away from the veal ossobucco... it was a bit salty... but everything else was great. Keep in mind they do not offer wine by the glass, so be prepared to order a bottle or choose something else to drink.
reviews.title: You're family, not merely a guest, at this wonderful establishment
This is the place to stay in Florence
reviews.text: My daughter and I were fortunate to find this gem of a hotel and had the pleasure of spending eight nights there last month.

reviews.title: Excellent staff and lovely hotels
reviews.text: Emanulle and Barbara did everything they could to make our stay in Florence easy and delighful and their input was invaluable to us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The real draw are the two wonderful proprietors, who make you feel like a member of their family. They can truly help with anything. For the price, this is a really fantastic place.
reviews.title: A Super Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Owners Emmanuele and Barbara are the consummate hosts. We felt like family, not merely another foreign couple in Florence for the first time. While the hotel amenities are luxurious, their personal attention is peerless, whether explaining directions, planning an itinerary or securing a restaurant reservation.
reviews.title: Great little hotel in a wonderful city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Spotlessly clean, elegantly decorated and much-loved by the owners, it was a delight to stay here. Hotel breakfast was excellent - fresh, generous, unhurried.
reviews.title: Quiet, comfortable, best breakfast

likes.liked: — Spaciousness of bedroom, quietness, warmth, breakfast

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: The owners were happy to speak English and to help with our halting Italian. Very helpful with advice on museums etc, and especially with suggestions for restaurants. Do go to 'Ristorante del Fagioli', just 400m from the hotel - the best value (eating out is expensive in Florence) and most helpful service we found anywhere.

reviews.title: The Privilege was all mine!
reviews.text: Other tips: Trains are outstanding value and the best way to visit Sienna, Lucca, Pisa etc. Pisa Airport to Florence is best by train. We used the Terravision bus to return to airport: it worked well. Electric buses in the city are great value and endless fun. Museums are an organisational and curatorial disgrace, but staff are charmingly helpful. March is good: the city must be an overcrowded, over-heated nightmare in the Summer. The AA 'CityPack Guide and Foldout Map' (£6.99) worked very well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I went through all the reviews for this particular hotel, and decided that we would like very much to find a friendly staff, who could give us advice and "inside" information.
reviews.title: Warm hospitality

likes.disliked: — The double rooms are not facing the river....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And I am very happy to "report" that the staff exceeded all our expectations. They gave us directions how to reach the hotel by car, were expecting us at the hour mentioned by us [we didn't make it, were almost 3 hours late...], took care of our car and were more than happy to give directions even to a mall outside Firenze. The room was big and quiet, as we requested, and the breakfast was copious. We liked the location by the river, even if they don't have double rooms facing it. It was an easy walk to all the main attractions. Highly recommended !!!
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in March. Despite the weather not agreeing with us the hotel was excellent. The location, right by the river, is beautiful was a nice easy walk to all of the attractions.
reviews.title: Lived up to all expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and made some excellent recommendations for dinner. Our room was large and the bed was huge.
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The breakfast was OK (coffee not that good) but it was the location, good level of cleanliness and friendly staff that makes this such a good choice.
reviews.title: Found this jewel by accident
I'm surprised....
reviews.text: I'm surprised by all the good reviews this hotel got. Besides the location, which is good, it is pretty lousy for the price we paid. it was so loud at night, that we couldn't sleep until 3am plus the room was horrible. I must say, it was big, but everything felt like it was falling apart. It was clean, but that's about it. We thought it was a nightmare and even the owners couldn't compensate for that. Sorry, but we would never chosse this hotel again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Privilege for 3 nights - our first visit to Florence and we came as tourists for sightseeing in Italy. The hotel and staff were exceptionally nice and the hotel was good value for money. The rooms were a good size, clean, comfortable and with aircon (very necessary). The location is perfect and an easy walk to the centre. The staff were extremely helpful and accomodating and helped us to arrange an onward travel itinerary and booked cars and hotels for us. They make an excellent breakfast here! Would recommend this place if you are looking for a good quality friendly 3 star hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: really great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: The Hotel Privilege was a great hotel! Such a wonderful location on the River Arno and within walking distance of everything in the historic part of the city. Rooms were suprisingly large by European standards.
reviews.title: It was our privilege
